articles.title: ‘Troika Plus’ to discuss Afghan crisis on Aug 11
articles.description: Key officials from Pakistan, US, Russia and China to meet in Doha
articles.content:
Senior officials from Pakistan, the United States, Russia and China will meet in Doha on August 11 as part of efforts to prevent Afghanistan from slipping into another civil war.

articles.title: Canada could be on cusp of fourth wave of Covid-19: Health authorities
articles.description: The country recorded 462 new cases of Covid-19 infections on Friday, an increase of over two-third over the numbers recorded two weeks earlier. | World News
articles.content:
Canadian health authorities have warned the country could be on the cusp of a fourth wave of the Covid-19 pandemic, driven by the Delta variant.

articles.title: As Opposition digs in heels on Pegasus, govt may curtail House session
articles.description: With the Pegasus row disrupting Parliament for the ninth straight day, sources said on Friday that the government is “seriously considering the curtailment of the Monsoon Session”.
articles.content:

articles.title: NSW Covid outbreak: death toll rises as two-thirds of 210 new cases under 40
articles.description: Man in his 60s dies at home in south-west Sydney as state reports new locally acquired cases
articles.content:
The death toll from the New South Wales coronavirus outbreak has risen to 14 after the death of a man at his home in south-west Sydney.
The news came as NSW reported 210 new locally acquired cases of Covid-19 on Saturday, two-thirds of whom were peop... [3882 chars]

articles.title: 5 changes coming into effect from August 1, will impact salary, EMI payments
articles.description: The changes coming into force from Sunday are a result of changes in rules introduced by the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) and regular updates introduced by banks.

articles.title: Water lakes were found at Martian South Pole in 2018. New findings say it was clay, not liquid
articles.description: In 3 papers published over a month, different teams reanalysed the 2018 Mars Express orbiter data to state that frozen clay, not salt water lakes, produced radar signals.
articles.content:
Text Size: A- A+
Bengaluru: In 2018, the radar onboard the European Space Agency’s Mars Express orbiter was announced to have found evidence of lakes of salt water underneath the ice at the south pole of the Red Planet.
